channel.title: attack.t1098 on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in attack.t1098 on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Powershell LocalAccount Manipulation
item.description: Adversaries may manipulate accounts to maintain access to victim systems. Account manipulation may consist of any action that preserves adversary access to a compromised account, such as modifying credentials or permission groups

item.title: Google Workspace Granted Domain API Access
item.description: Detects when an API access service account is granted domain authority.

item.title: Google Workspace User Granted Admin Privileges
item.description: Detects when an Google Workspace user is granted admin privileges.

item.title: Granting Of Permissions To An Account
item.description: Identifies IPs from which users grant access to other users on azure resources and alerts when a previously unseen source IP address is used.

item.title: Number Of Resource Creation Or Deployment Activities
item.description: Number of VM creations or deployment activities occur in Azure via the AzureActivity log.

item.title: AWS Route 53 Domain Transfer Lock Disabled
item.description: Detects when a transfer lock was removed from a Route 53 domain. It is recommended to refrain from performing this action unless intending to transfer the domain to a different registrar.

item.title: AWS Route 53 Domain Transferred to Another Account
item.description: Detects when a request has been made to transfer a Route 53 domain to another AWS account.

item.title: AWS User Login Profile Was Modified
item.description: An attacker with the iam:UpdateLoginProfile permission on other users can change the password used to login to the AWS console on any user that already has a login profile setup. With this alert, it is used to detect anyone is changing password on behalf of other users.

item.title: AWS IAM Backdoor Users Keys
item.description: Detects AWS API key creation for a user by another user. Backdoored users can be used to obtain persistence in the AWS environment. Also with this alert, you can detect a flow of AWS keys in your org.

item.title: Cisco Local Accounts
item.description: Find local accounts being created or modified as well as remote authentication configurations

item.title: User Added to Local Administrators
item.description: This rule triggers on user accounts that are added to the local Administrators group, which could be legitimate activity or a sign of privilege escalation activity

item.title: Password Change on Directory Service Restore Mode (DSRM) Account
item.description: The Directory Service Restore Mode (DSRM) account is a local administrator account on Domain Controllers. Attackers may change the password to gain persistence.

item.title: Addition of Domain Trusts
item.description: Addition of domains is seldom and should be verified for legitimacy.

item.title: Enabled User Right in AD to Control User Objects
item.description: Detects scenario where if a user is assigned the SeEnableDelegationPrivilege right in Active Directory it would allow control of other AD user objects.

item.title: Powerview Add-DomainObjectAcl DCSync AD Extend Right
item.description: backdooring domain object to grant the rights associated with DCSync to a regular user or machine account using Powerview\Add-DomainObjectAcl DCSync Extended Right cmdlet, will allow to re-obtain the pwd hashes of any user/computer
